candidates.title: chore: bump bt-hci version to 0.4.0 for cyw43
Adds WDT support for the nrf54l15
Add examples for W5500-EVB-Pico2
candidates.body:
Adds examples for the Wiznet W5500-EVB-Pico2 evalboard. I have tested all of the examples with the new hardware and all are functional except for examples/rp235x/src/bin/ethernet_w5500_multisocket.rs here is an example of the failure:
```

0.116362 [INFO ] Waiting for DHCP... (ethernet_w5500_multisocket src/bin/ethernet_w5500_multisocket.rs:84)
0.117179 [DEBUG] DHCP send DISCOVER to 255.255.255.255: Repr { message_type: Discover, transaction_id: 1508351018, secs: 0, client_hardware_address: 02-00-00-00-00-00, client_ip: 0.0.0.0, your_ip: 0.0.0.0, server_ip: 0.0.0.0, router: None, subnet_mask: None, relay_agent_ip: 0.0.0.0, broadcast: false, requested_ip: None, client_identifier: Some(02-00-00-00-00-00), server_identifier: None, parameter_request_list: Some([1, 3, 6]), dns_servers: None, max_size: Some(1432), lease_duration: None, renew_duration: None, rebind_duration: None, additional_options: [] } (smoltcp smoltcp-0.12.0/src/macros.rs:18)
2.123768 [INFO ] link_up = true (embassy_net embassy-net/src/lib.rs:838)
2.124070 [INFO ] IPv4: DOWN (embassy_net embassy-net/src/lib.rs:750)
2.125921 [DEBUG] DHCP send DISCOVER to 255.255.255.255: Repr { message_type: Discover, transaction_id: 1389185520, secs: 0, client_hardware_address: 02-00-00-00-00-00, client_ip: 0.0.0.0, your_ip: 0.0.0.0, server_ip: 0.0.0.0, router: None, subnet_mask: None, relay_agent_ip: 0.0.0.0, broadcast: false, requested_ip: None, client_identifier: Some(02-00-00-00-00-00), server_identifier: None, parameter_request_list: Some([1, 3, 6]), dns_servers: None, max_size: Some(1432), lease_duration: None, renew_duration: None, rebind_duration: None, additional_options: [] } (smoltcp smoltcp-0.12.0/src/macros.rs:18)
2.143864 [DEBUG] DHCP recv Offer from 192.168.0.1: Repr { message_type: Offer, transaction_id: 1389185520, secs: 0, client_hardware_address: 02-00-00-00-00-00, client_ip: 0.0.0.0, your_ip: 192.168.0.233, server_ip: 192.168.0.1, router: Some(192.168.0.1), subnet_mask: Some(255.255.255.0), relay_agent_ip: 0.0.0.0, broadcast: false, requested_ip: None, client_identifier: None, server_identifier: Some(192.168.0.1), parameter_request_list: None, dns_servers: Some([192.168.0.1]), max_size: None, lease_duration: Some(86400), renew_duration: Some(43200), rebind_duration: Some(75600), additional_options: [] } (smoltcp smoltcp-0.12.0/src/macros.rs:18)
2.146232 [DEBUG] DHCP send request to 255.255.255.255: Repr { message_type: Request, transaction_id: 495877001, secs: 0, client_hardware_address: 02-00-00-00-00-00, client_ip: 0.0.0.0, your_ip: 0.0.0.0, server_ip: 0.0.0.0, router: None, subnet_mask: None, relay_agent_ip: 0.0.0.0, broadcast: false, requested_ip: Some(192.168.0.233), client_identifier: Some(02-00-00-00-00-00), server_identifier: Some(192.168.0.1), parameter_request_list: Some([1, 3, 6]), dns_servers: None, max_size: Some(1432), lease_duration: None, renew_duration: None, rebind_duration: None, additional_options: [] } (smoltcp smoltcp-0.12.0/src/macros.rs:18)

2.166841 [DEBUG] IPv4: UP (embassy_net embassy-net/src/lib.rs:738)
2.166979 [DEBUG]    IP address:      192.168.0.233/24 (embassy_net embassy-net/src/lib.rs:739)

adding a socket to a full SocketSet (panic_probe panic-probe-1.0.0/src/lib.rs:104)
Firmware exited unexpectedly: Exception
 WARN probe_rs_debug::debug_info: UNWIND: Error while checking for exception context. The stack trace will not include the calling frames. : Probe(Register("No Stack Pointer register. Please report this as a bug."))
Core 0
    Frame 0: HardFault_ @ 0x10042204
       /home/rice/.cargo/registry/src/index.crates.io-1949cf8c6b5b557f/cortex-m-rt-0.7.5/src/lib.rs:1103:1
    Frame 1: UNWIND: Error while checking for exception context. The stack trace will not include the calling frames. : Probe(Register("No Stack Pointer register. Please report this as a bug.")) @ 0x10042204

Core 1
    Frame 0: is_valid_allocation_size @ 0x000000ec inline
       /home/rice/.rustup/toolchains/1.88-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/core/src/ub_checks.rs:134:54
    Frame 1: defmt_rtt::BUFFER @ 0xfa050000> @ 0x00000000fa050000
```

I have left the code in for discussion but it should not be merged in.

Thanks

candidates.title: nrf54l15 Rramc (Nvmc) support
candidates.body:
Adding basic support for RRAMC to nrf54l15 (nrf54l15-app-s only). Exposed as Nvmc for downstream compatibility. 

I am submitting this as a Draft PR as I am unsure how it fits with [4393](https://github.com/embassy-rs/embassy/pull/4393).

candidates.title: Updated stm32-metapac for GPDMA1 fix on STM32WBA
candidates.body: This PR updates `stm32-metapac` based on this [PR](https://github.com/embassy-rs/stm32-data/pull/655). With this in place more peripherals can use DMA channels on the STM32WBA series.

candidates.title: chore: prepare release of embassy-nrf and embassy-rp
feat: lpc55 blocking usart added
candidates.body:
Hello! For LPC55 USART with blocking mode was implemented.

- Implemented structure `Usart` which can be split into `UsartRx` and `UsartTx`
- Implemented `Blocking` mode
- Added `Config` and `Error`
- All the sufficient IO-functions for `Blocking` mode were implemented
- `Usart` was made generic for the sake of flexibility
- All the interactions with PAC are hidden macro called `impl_instance!()`
- Added USART peripherals for LPC55
- Added example `usart_blocking.rs` for demonstration

@george-cosma, please review this PR

candidates.title: Release executor 0.8
candidates.body: It's a lot of goodies since 0.7, especially the task arena removal. Might want to rebase this on https://github.com/embassy-rs/embassy/pull/4443 before merging. Any other PRs that should get in first?

candidates.title: STM32WBA usb-dfu example
candidates.body:
With the addition of USB_OTG_HS support on the WBA65 devices I took the liberty of adapting the current examples on the STM32WB devices to my Nucleo board. The main differences are:

- The memory.x files for both the application and the bootloader have to account for the larger flash and memory (1/2MM and 256/512KB)
- The new examples run off the HSI (in case the HSE isn't connected to a crystal)
- The examples are proven to work on the STM32WBA65RIVx Nucleotide board.

candidates.title: Feat/stm32wba usb example
candidates.body:
The STM32WBA65RI device has USB_OTG_HS unlike the STM32WBA5XXX series devices. This necessitates moving and creating some examples using this device. The USB peripheral and these additional examples are confirmed to work on the NUCLEO_STM32WBA65RIVx.

- Fixes to USB_OTG_HS initialization
- WBA65 USB core ID is 6100. Added new config check (used same config as u5 - works fine)
- All previous WBA examples ported to new device (minor pin remapping)

candidates.title: Add `embassy-net` `defmt` derives for config structs
candidates.body: This PR adds some missing `defmt` derives to `embassy-net` so that IP address and other configuration can more easily be inspected.

candidates.title: Added support for PLL as a clock source on STM32WBA
candidates.body:
The RCC HAL for WBA devices had support for HSE and HSI but not for the PLL. That support has been added due to the recent additions in `stm32-data` that added the PLL enums. With that in place a new addition is the inclusion of sanity checks for the PLL VCO generated frequency (it'll panic just like in the U5 HAL). That aside there's also the addition of the PLLFRACN fractional multiplier. That has also been added. The frequency asserts also take this PLLFRACN into account.

A timer example has also been added showcasing this new support for the PLL.

candidates.title: feat: add RTC time driver
embassy-embedded-hal: make time feature non-default
candidates.body: default features considered harmful.

candidates.title: fix: stm32 i2c slave blocking r/w
candidates.body:
originally from #4316

- removed defmt:: and explicit defmt cfg checks
- rebased

closes #4316

This fixes an issue where the slave interface would time out when the
master goes from a short write to a read (e.g. when accessing memory
registers) with a START signal between. The previous implementation
would expect the full buffer length to be written before starting to
listen to new commands.

This also adds debug trace printing which helped during implemention and
testing.

Places error checking into a function inspired from a C implementation
of HAL.

candidates.title: Chore: prepare release for `embassy-usb-synopsys-otg` and `embassy-usb-logger`
candidates.body:
`embassy-usb-driver` v0.2.0 was just released, this PR bumps `embassy-usb-synopsys-otg` and `embassy-usb-logger` version for a new release. 

Closes #4423

candidates.title: nxp: Add mimxrt1062 support
candidates.body:
Depends on #4419

The examples in this case are designed for the IMXRT1060-EVK.

The same chip is used in the Teensy 4.0/1, but that will probably get its own set of examples due to some differences such as the FCB and how it is flashed.

candidates.title: chore: Prepare release for `embassy-boot-*` crates
candidates.body: Prepare the bootloader crates for a release with `embassy-sync@0.7.0` as dependency for compatiblity with other released crates. `embassy-sync` is used in the public api of `embassy-boot` which is reexported by the `embassy-boot-*` crates. That is why a minor version bump of all crates is required.

candidates.title: Updates to support stm32c071
candidates.body:
Modifications required to support the STMC071 as used in the Nucleo-C071RB development board.
Untested changes, but building locally

candidates.title: stm32wb: Add rfwkpsel to ClockMux
candidates.body:
Fixes https://github.com/embassy-rs/embassy/issues/4421 by exposing rfwkpsel in `ClockMux`

~~Depends on https://github.com/embassy-rs/stm32-data/pull/643~~ Merged
~~Depends on https://github.com/embassy-rs/stm32-data/pull/648~~ Merged

candidates.title: nxp: Add MIMXRT1011 GPIO and time driver
candidates.body:
The start of #4345, this time the IMXRT parts.

So far a GPIO and time driver.

The PIT driver is a bit unfortunate for the moment with the potential drift. Will see in the future if the general purpose timer can do a better job.

candidates.title: feat: added log-to-defmt feature to embassy-nxp
candidates.body:
- Added an option of using ```log``` crate so that it is printed via ```defmt```
- Added a small example for this (```examples/lpc55s69/src/bin/log_to_defmt.rs```)

It would be great if ```embassy-nxp``` had ```log``` crate support for debugging in the future. For this I have added ```log-to-defmt``` crate and ```log_to_defmt``` feature in ```Cargo.toml```. It can be tested using ```--feature``` flag while calling ```cargo run```.

candidates.title: STM32F107: Fix inadvertent re-configuration of the SWJ/JTAG pins when activating the (R)MII interface
candidates.body: AFIO_MAPR.SWJ_CFG must be written as 0b111 to leave its value unchanged.

candidates.title: stm32: fix stm32g0b0 build.
candidates.body: It has USB but not HSI48 which would break things. Only g0x1 has HSI48.

candidates.title: feat: add embassy-release tool
candidates.body:
* Print dependencies of a crate
* Bump version in dependent crates
* Release using cargo release
* Config file to control features and target

The idea is that the tool can be used to simplify the tasks of releasing, and gradually performing more and more of the tasks required to do a release. It's not intended as yet another release tool for rust, but for calling out to other tools to do the tasks required for a release.

candidates.title: docs: add missing feature for doc gen
Adds ADC4 for STM32WBA series
candidates.body:
This adds ADC support for the WBA series, using the already existing ADC4 support for the U5 series.
This was tested on a WBA55CG. 
There are probably some simplifications to be made, but this at least works.

I haven't tested the u5 after these changes because I don't own one.

candidates.title: Minimise build profile tweaking in rp/rp235x examples
candidates.body:
To avoid confusion around build profile tweaks (see #4346), remove optimisation/lto changes and just enable generation of debug symbols for release profiles.
Also add a comment explaining that it is intentional so it is less likely to be seen as a mistake in the examples.

candidates.title: Fix Release and Dev Profiles Being Backwards in rp235x Examples
nxp: add feature for lpc55
candidates.body: this is needed since I will be working on adding support for the MCX and iMXRT families to embassy-nxp

candidates.title: Added STM32WBA6XXX devices as features
candidates.body:
Added the following
- new devices (a.k.a. features) from `stm32-data`
- within `ci.sh`: attempt to build 2 `stm32wba6[2|5]` devices
- handled a default rtc implementation if the generated peripherals didn't match the mapping.
- handled a new generated peripheral `rtc_v3c0` recently introduced to `stm32-data-generated`

candidates.title: Adapt to new opamp pin naming scheme and opamp IP version numbers
candidates.body:
The new code implements the corresponding traits for the common opamp pin naming scheme of all families, which is VINPx/VINMx and adapts the opamp driver to new opamp IP version numbers.

The same pin must not be used for multiple channels for the same opamp. For example, if VINM0 and VINM1 of the same opamp were assigned to the same pin, the channel would not be unique, meaning that the traits would be implemented in a conflicting manner.

candidates.title: mspm0: add dma driver
candidates.body:
Add a DMA driver for mspm0. So far only implement features available on all (basic) channels. copying slices is also not implemented yet nor anything related to source/destination stride. 

~~A few things pending before this is ready to review~~
- [x] merge https://github.com/mspm0-rs/mspm0-data/pull/6
- [x] add tests for u16, u32 and u64 transfers
- [x] ~~Figure out why `TransferMode::Single` with `dst.len() > 2` performs 2 transfers instead of 1 (as expected in datasheet)~~ (likely hardware bug)
- [x] ~~Test multiple triggers (`resume()`)~~
- [x] Remove the settings.json changes (after I am done)
